comment.author: 8110957@N08
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called ANYTHING GOES ENGLAND,VINTAGE PHOTOS,POSTCARDS,EPHEMERAetc..., and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 42117802@N06
comment._content: Not into modern liners , but it cannot be denied that this was a majestic ship and a thing of pure beauty.

comment.author: 11423890@N00
comment._content: My Grandad John Rees sailed on the Lusitania from Liverpool to New York on his way to Vermillion, Ill. He was a Welsh coal miner and was planning to bring his wife Stella and daughter Mary to a new life in America. Stella died and John eventually made it back home to rescue his daughter. Sixty years later I completed his dream.
